body: I think it would be safer to return `const std::string&` rather than `const char*`. This way if someone wants to copy it they can capture it in their own std::string
body_html: I think it would be safer to return const std::string& rather than const char*. This way if someone wants to copy it they can capture it in their own std::string
body_text: I think it would be safer to return const std::string& rather than const char*. This way if someone wants to copy it they can capture it in their own std::string
